description: An opportunity to see and hear first hand about the complexities of a multi phased regeneration project. On completion High Path will comprise over 1,700 homes including new homes for existing residents and a new public park.

factsheet.heading: Introduction
paragraphs: High Path is being transformed as part of a £1.3bn investment by Clarion Housing Group in the London Borough of Merton. Clarion are working with the London Borough of Merton, residents and other local stakeholders to completely remodel three existing neighbourhoods.

High Path, South Wimbledon is the largest of the three (alongside, Eastfields and Ravensbury). In total, the project will create over 2,700 homes, replacing over 1,000 existing properties and building an additional 1,700 homes. Over 1,700 of these homes will be on High Path.

On High Path, Clarion is building new energy efficient homes designed by award-winning architects PRP. All existing residents are offered new homes on the estate. There will also be a range of environmental improvements, including extensive tree planting, an air source heat pump-based energy centre, underground refuse services and sustainable urban drainage.

Built from the 1950s through the 1980s, the buildings no longer meet modern requirements. The plans to regenerate High Path were developed following an extensive programme of engagement with residents, ward councillors and other stakeholders. This culminated in an estate-wide test of opinion conducted by the Electoral Reform Society, where residents confirmed their support for the plans.

Residents told Clarion they wanted a safer and more pedestrian-friendly neighbourhood, and to keep the community together. This principle of keeping the community in situ and intact whilst we remodel their neighbourhood and build new homes is central to Clarion’s approach to regeneration.

At High Path we will provide:
•	Over 1,700 new high quality homes each with private outdoor space
•	Every social rented property replaced and an increase in the social rented floor space
•	New neighbourhood park, public square and play spaces
•	New community centre
•	Commercial and retail space on Merton High Street and along the new park
•	Opportunities for new jobs

factsheet.heading: New homes
paragraphs: Built on the site of old garages and the Old Lamp Works, the first phase of the High Path regeneration is complete and 134 households have moved into or are moving into their new homes. The five new blocks comprise one, two and three-bedroom flats and town houses which are home to existing social tenants and resident homeowners.

Type of new home:
•	Flats
•	Maisonettes
•	Town houses
Early works for the second phase of the regeneration are underway. This will provide 113 new homes for residents currently living on High Path.

factsheet.heading: The landscape
paragraphs: Clarion is creating a welcoming, green neighbourhood built around an award winning PRP-designed masterplan that is easy-to-navigate with legible, tree-lined streets, as well as a new public park and community facilities.

The new park will feature seasonal flowers, shrubs and a border lined with trees. This will complement the balcony greening project already underway. There will also be a play trail for children. A civic square in the park will be a venue for outdoor community events.

New retail and commercial facilities on Merton High Street and Morden Road will create a commercial hub near South Wimbledon Tube station, with facilities including restaurants, cafes and a new community centre.

factsheet.heading: Design
paragraphs: The new buildings have been designed to reflect the architecture of the surrounding neighbourhoods, set within mixed and diverse land uses which will last for generations.

Phase two, due to start early 2023, has already won two design awards. The neighbourhood has a rich heritage, with strong local connections to Lord Nelson and Emma Hamilton, as well as Victorian designer William Morris and ceramicist William De Morgan. One the challenges the design teams have been set is to reflect that heritage in the landscape, homes and public realm we are creating.

factsheet.heading: Sustainability
paragraphs:
The regeneration programme has sustainability features including: 
•	Energy efficient and net zero compliant homes
•	District heat network and an Air Source Heat Pump system using electricity rather than gas
•	Green and brown roofs
•	Sustainable Drainage Systems (SUDS)
•	Underground Refuse System for general waste and recycling
•	Circular Economy Strategy
